title: Present Simple: Positive
description: Слушайте короткие утвердительные предложения в Present Simple.

tasks.audioText: He wakes up at six. He goes to work every day. He wakes up at six.

options.text: He went to bed at six.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says he wakes at six regularly. Other options change the time or tense.

tasks.audioText: At the cafe she drinks coffee. She loves black coffee. She drinks coffee every morning.
tasks.explanation: The sentence describes a habit now. Other options change time or tense.

tasks.audioText: They arrive at the market. They buy fruit each weekend. They buy fruit each weekend.
tasks.explanation: The sentence shows a regular action. Other options change frequency or tense.

tasks.audioText: At the office he checks emails. He answers messages quickly. He answers messages quickly.

options.text: He is answering a message now.

tasks.explanation: The sentence states a usual behavior. Other options change speed or tense.

tasks.audioText: She visits the bank on Mondays. She pays bills there. She visits the bank on Mondays.
tasks.transcript: She visits the bank on Mondays.

options.text: She visits the bank on Mondays.
She visits the bank on Fridays.
She is visiting the bank now.

tasks.explanation: The sentence shows a routine. Other options change the day or tense.

tasks.audioText: The teacher checks homework every day. The students listen. The teacher checks homework every day.
tasks.transcript: The teacher checks homework every day.

options.text: The teacher checks homework every day.
The teacher checks homework once a week.
The teacher is checking homework now.

tasks.explanation: The sentence describes a daily habit. Other options change frequency or tense.

tasks.audioText: He walks to work in the park. He likes fresh air. He walks to work every day.
tasks.transcript: He walks to work every day.

options.text: He walks to work every day.
He takes a car every day.
He is walking to work now.

tasks.explanation: The sentence states a regular action. Other options change the method or tense.

tasks.audioText: At the shop the seller counts shirts. He sells many shirts. He sells many shirts.

options.text: He is selling a shirt now.

tasks.explanation: The sentence describes what he does regularly. Other options change quantity or tense.

tasks.audioText: She cooks dinner at six. Her family waits. She cooks dinner at six.
tasks.explanation: The sentence shows a regular time for cooking. Other options change the time or tense.

tasks.audioText: The bus stops at this corner. People get on. The bus stops at this corner.
tasks.transcript: The bus stops at this corner.

options.text: The bus stops at this corner.
The bus stops at the next corner.

tasks.explanation: The sentence states a regular route. Other options change location or tense.

tasks.audioText: He trains in the gym three times a week. He lifts weights. He trains in the gym three times a week.
tasks.transcript: He trains in the gym three times a week.

options.text: He trains in the gym three times a week.
He trained three times last week.

tasks.explanation: The sentence shows a habitual schedule. Other options change frequency or tense.

tasks.audioText: The store opens at nine every morning. Customers come early. The store opens at nine.
tasks.explanation: The sentence gives the usual opening time. Other options change time or tense.

tasks.audioText: At the clinic the doctor checks records. He helps many patients. He helps many patients.

options.text: He is helping a patient now.

tasks.explanation: The sentence describes his regular work. Other options change number or tense.

tasks.audioText: She checks her calendar at work. She starts meetings at nine. She starts meetings at nine.

options.text: She is starting a meeting now.

tasks.explanation: The sentence shows a regular schedule. Other options change time or tense.

tasks.audioText: They clean the house on Saturdays. The house is tidy then. They clean the house on Saturdays.
tasks.transcript: They clean the house on Saturdays.

options.text: They clean the house on Saturdays.
They clean the house on Sundays.
They are cleaning the house now.

tasks.explanation: The sentence shows a weekly habit. Other options change the day or tense.
